child.pub-comments: It is not clear what to do with this language and its dialects. Ethnologue lists it as a cluster of dialects, but Newman lists Jimi as being a dialect of Guruntum, Jimo as being equivalent to Zumu, and Jimjimum (which may be the Jimjimen the Ethnologue lists) as being possibly a dialect of Matakam. For the while, this is left simply as a member of the Bata (Biu-Mandara A8) group.
Newman (1990) lists this as a dialect of Bata.
child.publications: Newman, Paul. 1990. Nominal and Verbal Plurality in Chadic. Dordrecht: Foris.

child.pub-comments: Both Peve and Zime have the other's names as alternate names. So it is surmised that Newman means code lme to be Peve, and code hed to be Zime. But the first is called Zime in Ethnologue, and the latter Herdé in Ethnologue.
